CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 12, 1952, pg. 34 reads: "New Electives Take Office - Two of the most controversial candidates but winners in the Nov. 6 elections attracted enormous crowds to the court house on Jan. 4 and 7. District Attorney James F. Malone Jr. took the oath of office Jan. 4 and State Senator John M. Walker was sworn in Jan. 7 as a minority member of the Board of County Commissioners.  Both are Republicans...Top right, Common Pleas Court Judge Walter P. Smart administers the oath to County Commissioners John J. Kane, Harry W. Fowler and John M. Walker.  Mr. Kane is entering his fifth term.  Mr. Fowler, appointed to the vacancy caused by the death of George H. Rankin, was elected for the first time in November, and John M. Walker, Majority Floor leader of the State Senate, is also a first-term member of the Board of County Commissioners...Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Judge Walter P. Smart, administering oath to County Commissioners John J. Kane, Harry W. Fowler and John M. Walker, in Allegheny County Courthouse
